text:
Question for the group: If I have an Android APK add a parameter to a URL before a client device hits the CMS page:

<https://www.HubSpotdomain.com/contactid=*54325634*&customobjectid=*3647589*>

Is there a way for that to be sufficient authentication for HubSpot to recognize the user and display smart content accordingly?

Ideally I want HubSpot to look at the smart content element and say, “If the identified user is in [list A], show content A. If the user is in [list B], show content B. Else if the user is not in either list, play content C. This would be for pages where 80% of the content is displayed ‘as is’ to all visitors, and just 20% of the elements on the page are dynamic and need to identify the user before determining what to render.

It seems like maybe there’s a way: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/create-and-manage-smart-content-rules>
You can create repeater fields when creating costume modules. It's actually quite intuitive
